intro: Grindelia havardii, commonly known as the Havard's gumweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its grayish-green, fuzzy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal and inland desert regions. It produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into fluffy, seed-filled structures. Grindelia havardii is adapted to arid environments and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
